channel.title: Posts on BumbleBeast Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on BumbleBeast Blog

item.title: Intro to BumbleBeast
item.description: So, What is BumbleBeast? It is a milling machine first - a monsterously powerful one at that. But it does plenty more than the standard desktop mill. Features It can machine aluminum alloys at optimal speeds and feeds, with accuracy of 25 microns (0.001 in.) or better. It has 5 axes of movement to reduce production time up to 90% for parts with multi-faced or organic features.

item.title: History
item.description: Seed of an Idea It started in Fall 2015, junior year of college. Hao and myself were roommates. We were both taking classes on design and manufacturing. Before this, we had each used a 3d printer once or twice for some small projects. But we were never too impressed with what came out. You could get a tiny, flimsy, inaccurate part made in a couple of hours, while more complex prints could take days.

item.title: Progress!
item.description:
Let’s catch up a little bit with the progress we’ve made so far with BumbleBeast:

2017-09-01: Joined HMC INQ Incubator

2017-11-06: 1st working prototype

2018-05-10: 2nd working prototype

2018-10-10: Working beta machine

2018-10-18: 2 provisional patents

item.description:
Welcome to the BumbleBeast blog!

More soon to come.
